Class Zoo

java.lang.Object
Zoo
public class Zoo extends Object
Represents a zoo that categorizes animals into dangerous or safe groups based on a configurable danger threshold. Animals with a danger level greater than or equal to the threshold are placed in the dangerous group, while those below the threshold are placed in the safe group.

The zoo can be created empty or loaded from a file, and supports operations for adding, removing, and retrieving animals in each category, as well as adjusting the danger threshold.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Zoo(int dangerThreshold)
    Creates a new empty zoo with the specified danger threshold.
    Zoo(String filename, int dangerThreshold)
    Creates a new zoo by loading animal data from a file and applying the specified danger threshold.

    Adds an animal to the zoo, placing it into either the safe or dangerous group based on the current danger threshold.

    Removes the specified animal from the zoo, regardless of whether it is safe or dangerous.

  • Constructor Details

    • Zoo

      public Zoo(int dangerThreshold)
      Creates a new empty zoo with the specified danger threshold.
      Parameters:
      dangerThreshold - the threshold for determining whether an animal is dangerous, must be between 0 and 10 inclusive
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the threshold is outside the valid range

    • Zoo

      public Zoo(String filename, int dangerThreshold) throws FileNotFoundException
      Creates a new zoo by loading animal data from a file and applying the specified danger threshold.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file containing animal data
      dangerThreshold - the threshold for determining whether an animal is dangerous, must be between 0 and 10 inclusive
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the specified file does not exist
      IllegalArgumentException - if the threshold is outside the valid range or if the file format is invalid

  • Method Details

    • load

      public void load(String filename) throws FileNotFoundException
      Loads animal data from a file and adds them to the zoo based on the current danger threshold. Each line in the file should contain a species, ta name, and a danger level.
      Parameters:
      filename - the name of the file containing animal data
      Throws:
      FileNotFoundException - if the specified file does not exist
      IllegalArgumentException - if the file format is invalid

    • add

      public void add(Animal animal)
      Adds an animal to the zoo, placing it into either the safe or dangerous group based on the current danger threshold.
      Parameters:
      animal - the animal to add

    • remove

      public void remove(Animal animal)
      Removes the specified animal from the zoo, regardless of whether it is safe or dangerous.
      Parameters:
      animal - the animal to remove

    • getDangerThreshold

      public int getDangerThreshold()
      Returns the danger threshold of the Zoo
      Returns:
      the danger threshold espresenting the minimum danger level of an animal to be considered dangerous

    • getDangerous

      public Set<Animal> getDangerous()
      Returns a list of all dangerous animals in the zoo.
      Returns:
      a list containing all animals whose danger level is greater than or equal to the threshold

    • getSafe

      public Set<Animal> getSafe()
      Returns a list of all safe animals in the zoo.
      Returns:
      a list containing all animals whose danger level is less than the threshold

    • adjustDangerThreshold

      public void adjustDangerThreshold(int dangerThreshold)
      Adjusts the zoo's danger threshold and reclassifies all animals between the safe and dangerous groups based on the new threshold.
      Parameters:
      dangerThreshold - the new danger threshold, must be between 0 and 10 inclusive
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the threshold is outside the valid range

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the zoo, including the current danger threshold and the contents of both the dangerous and safe animal collections.

      The format is: 

       dangerThreshold: [threshold value]
 Dangerous: [dangerous animals as returned by their toString()]
 Safe: [safe animals as returned by their toString()]
      , which shows the animals in curly braces separated by commas.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a multi-line string containing the zoo's threshold and the contents of both animal groups
